title: Default search engine | Search bar | LockPref?
content:
Good day, I have tried to find the setting for the default search engine in the about:config, but according to this statement in another question it is for quite some time unavailable in the Firefox. (used PaleMoon before) "The keyword.URL preference is no longer used in Firefox 23 or above and setting the engine for address bar searches is now done from the Search Bar -see Search with the Firefox address bar."

However, the "Search with the Firefox address bar" page shows (if I have not overlooked something) only the GUI guide and it is only for the current profile. My question is rather; is there a way to change the default search engine from Google to DuckDuckGo by a config file, e.g. lockPref, please? I would like the setting to affect all the profiles and be in the installation folder if possible.

Thank you very much for any information. Also, I am sorry if I have overlooked a post dealing with this problem - the search query "default search" returns 870 posts. Here comes the 871st I guess, heh.
creator: Carduus

title: Why does Firefox change my PDF viewing choice from Adobe to Firefox?
content:
My OS is Win 7 Pro 64-bit, and I'm running FFv. 81.0.2 32-bit. 

I have my Windows system set to open any PDF file using Adobe Reader.

All PDF files show the Adobe icon, and open with Adobe from my desktop or my other browsers (Pale Moon and Internet Explorer). However, in FF, they open using FF, and change all my settings and icons to show as FF icons and all PDF file to open with FF. I have all my settings in the FF options to use Adobe Reader for all PDF and other Adobe documents to use Adobe Reader, but FF still insists on opening PDF files and changing all PDF icons to the FF icon (i.e., breaking the PDF associations with Adobe Reader that I had previously set). I have to go into my control panel to associate the PDF extension with Adobe each time this happens.

How can I stop FF from doing this?
creator: LesF

title: Firefox open link on google with new tab, not in the same tab.
content:
I usually open link google in the same tab when i clicked it. but now it always open on new tab, i tried

-browser.link.open_newwindow / 1 -browser.link.open_newwindow.restriction / 0 -browser.link.open_newwindow.override.external / 3

And its work, but when i open external link on whatsapp web, it doing the same like open link on google (open in the same tab), before this error happen, whatsapp web was always open the new tab for external link.

How can i set for google opening link on the same tab, and whatsapp web can open external link on the new tab?

title: Firefox constantly crashing over last couple of months
content: HI. Firefox has been regularly crashing over the last month or two. Today it's crashed 4-5 times in 10 minutes. I tried sfc /scannow just now and there were no integrity violations. I've always submitted the crash report immediately after each event, however the last few were unsubmitted when I checked the log just now, so I've submitted them too. Firefox has always been updated to the latest version. Any ideas? Cheers Ian
